definition: dirty soil/dung/muck
manure/dung
Tu (ethnic group)/surname Tu
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to look upon as dirt/considered worthless

sentences.english: That pigeon was just as dead as a turd.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，是傑克，那隻鴿子像糞土一樣躺在那兒。

sentences.english: So the excrement of earthworm was recommended as covering materials for the ecological restoration of municipal waste landfill sites.
sentences.chinese: 可見蚓糞土宜作垃圾填埋場生態復墾的覆蓋材料。

sentences.english: They treat their workers like dirt.
sentences.chinese: 他們把工人看得糞土不如。

sentences.english: These bricks was brought in gold price and sold like dung.
sentences.chinese: 這些磚瓦買進時似黃金，賣出時似糞土。

sentences.english: If we do not make good use of it, is also seen as devaluing .
sentences.chinese: 如果我們不好好利用它，同樣是視爲糞土的。

sentences.english: He lifts up the poor from the dust and the needy from the ash heap.
sentences.chinese: 從塵埃裏提拔弱小的人，由糞土中舉揚窮苦的人。

sentences.english: And fear not the words of a sinful man, for his glory is dung, and worms.
sentences.chinese: 不要怕惡人的議論，因爲他們的光榮要變成糞土蛆蟲。

definition: to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
incurable/incorrigible/beyond cure/hopeless
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
ungrateful/heartless/to fail to be loyal to one's love
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
poor and humble family/my family (humble)
everywhere
Arthur Schopenhauer (1788-1860), German post-Kantian philosopher
chastity
to like to lecture others (idiom)
lamentable/sad(ly)
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
